metadata.title: CVE-2018-15688 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A buffer overflow vulnerability in the dhcp6 client of systemd allows amalicious dhcp6 server to overwrite heap memory in systemd-networkd.Affected releases are systemd: versions up to and including 239.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-15688` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-myhostname - 229-4ubuntu21.6
libnss-mymachines - 229-4ubuntu21.6
libnss-resolve - 229-4ubuntu21.6
libpam-systemd - 229-4ubuntu21.6
libsystemd0 - 229-4ubuntu21.6
libudev1 - 229-4ubuntu21.6
systemd - 229-4ubuntu21.6
systemd-container - 229-4ubuntu21.6
systemd-coredump - 229-4ubuntu21.6
systemd-journal-remote - 229-4ubuntu21.6
systemd-sysv - 229-4ubuntu21.6
udev - 229-4ubuntu21.6
No subscription required

gir1.2-networkmanager-1.0 - 1.2.6-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
libnm-glib-vpn1 - 1.2.6-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
libnm-glib4 - 1.2.6-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
libnm-util2 - 1.2.6-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
libnm0 - 1.2.6-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
network-manager - 1.2.6-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
No subscription required
